intro: Sampera pichinchensis, commonly known as the Andean bellflower, is a flowering plant native to the high-altitude regions of the Andes. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped, violet-blue flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and thrives in cool, temperate climates. Its leaves are lance-shaped and covered in a fine, silvery pubescence. Sampera pichinchensis is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
